greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Has simplest possible tree complexity of all transcendental sequences.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
H. Niederreiter and M. Vielhaber, Tree complexity and a doubly exponential gap between structured and random sequences, J. Complexity, 12 (1996), 187-198.
formula: a(n) = 1 iff, in the binary expansion of n, reading from right to left, the number of 1's never exceeds the number of 0's.
mathematica: (* b = A036989 *) b[0] = 1; b[n_?EvenQ] := b[n] = Max[b[n/2] - 1, 1]; b[n_] := b[n] = b[(n-1)/2] + 1; a[n_] := Boole[b[n] == 1]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 104}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 05 2013, after _Reinhard Zumkeller_ *)
xref: Cf. A036989. Characteristic function of A036990.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
ext: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Sep 25 2000
